summary:
## Ocean Sunfish: Giant Fish with a Unique Shape

The ocean sunfish, Mola mola, is one of the biggest bony fish. It weighs between 545 to 2205 pounds and looks like a fish head without a tail. Found worldwide in tropical and temperate waters, they have a flattened body and can be as tall as they are long.

Sunfish have few natural predators, but are hunted by sea lions, killer whales, and sharks. While some cultures consider them a delicacy, the EU bans their sale. Researchers are still learning about these fascinating fish.
title: Ocean sunfish
